intro: Hedysarum aculeolatum var. capitellatum, commonly known as the clustered needlepod, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and distinctive, clustered pods. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open woodlands and grasslands. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies and native plant gardens.
